user.biography:
🎗Mommy to Eliza🎗 8/10/2018 -🦋- 6/20/2021
Fiancé: @mo_chance_ 
*Click below for Eliza Merch* 9/10 - 9/30

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on September 09, 2021. May be a cartoon.

node.text:
🎗🎗🎗NEW ELIZA MERCH🎗🎗🎗 

Launch Date: 9/10 @ 12 pm EST

"When the links of life are broken and a child has to part, there is nothing that will ever heal a parent's broken heart."

As Eliza's parents, the two people who loved and will always love Eliza most in this world, we know this sentiment to be painfully true. 

For those of you who never had the opportunity to physically meet Eliza, to truly witness the ways in which she embodied life, we still feel your love for her. We see how she has inspired not only us but also millions of people who got to "know" her through social media outlets. We know Eliza's life, albeit short but whole, has changed millions of peoples' perspectives on how to truly live life. To live for every moment with purpose, even if you don't know exactly what that elusive purpose is yet. 

Eliza inspired millions of people. Eliza taught us how to appreciate every moment. Even the moments that hurt us. Because eventually those moments become memories. And memories become lessons on what is and isn't important in a life so undeniably fragile and finite.

Eliza may not physically be here anymore, but the memories she instilled will forever dance in our minds. Eliza's life, a tragic yet inspiring short story, is a life worth studying. A life to be remembered. Through us and through all of you.

The decision to create this new Eliza Merch was inspired by of all of you and the ripple effect of previous Eliza Merch. It was emotional to hear about all the conversations people were having with strangers based on the Eliza Merch you were wearing. Somehow, a simple piece of clothing inspired conversations about our daughter, Eliza. Conversations about life and even death. All of you are a huge part of the reason that Eliza's memory bursts out of the shadows and into the forefront of so many minds. 

Eliza will always be with us. Maybe not physically, but in every other way imaginable.

As always, "Frog You, Cancer"

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on September 09, 2021. May be an image of one or more people and text that says 'FROG YOU, CONCER! NCER!'.

node.text: "All grown-ups were once children - although few of them remember it."

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on August 25, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and indoor.

node.text:
For most women, it's just an OBGYN appointment. 

It's about yearly appointments to discuss birth control options. It's about annual pap smears. It's about getting refills on prescriptions. It's about how to get pregnant or how to prevent pregnancy. 

For pregnant women, it's much more than that. It's about ultrasounds and lifestyle choices. It's about putting the baby's health first while also encouraging healthy trimesters for the mother. It's about survival, at the very least. For both mother and child. It's about happiness, nervousness, joy, panic, comfort. It's about hope. 

For me, it's about memories. It's about what was and what can and cannot be.  It's about seeing women in the waiting room with babies crying. It's about wishing I could hear cries echoing throughout our home. It's about avoiding eye contact with everyone.  It's about discussing my wants that may not be what Chance wants. 

It's about choosing when or if we harvest my eggs.  It's about fertilizing my eggs and testing the embryos. It's about the gut-feeling fear that all our embryos will test positive for the SMARCB1 gene mutation they inherited from me. It's about not being able to conceive naturally. It's about choosing to conceive naturally and fearing every possible outcome. It's about choosing which risks to take. It's about no guarantees.

It's about the loss I feel every millisecond of every day. It's about knowing I can't ever bring her back. It's about wanting a healthy child but worrying that I'm trying to fill the void too soon. It's about knowing that the void will always remain. It's about questioning every decision I made and will make. 

It's about memories we have and memories that were stolen. It's about comtemplating new memories with another child. It's about questioning choices I made and choices I am facing. It's about balancing fear and hope, as both weigh heavy on me.

It's about being a bereaved mother, a Vilomah, grieving the loss of her only child. 

It's about wanting to hear "Mommy, I love you" again, and again, and again...

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on August 22, 2021. May be a closeup of 1 person.

node.text:
I'm not sure how long it's been since I've last showered. 

Or how long it's been since I've actually given a fuck. 

Or how long it's been since I've smiled without holding back tidal waves.

Or how long it's been since I've wanted to be intimate. Even with myself.

Or how long it's been since I've thought about the repercussions of death as opposed to life.

Or how long it's been since I've looked in the mirror and recognized even a fragment of myself.

Or how long it's been since I've felt comfortable in public.

Or how long it's been since I've hated the idea of God. 

Or how long it's been since I've surrendered to life's most meaningless metaphors:

•
•
•

Time.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on August 17, 2021. May be a cartoon of 2 people.

node.text:
Dear Caricature Artists: Would you be willing to draw our Eliza?

There are hundreds of photos and videos to reference (IG and TikTok) in order to truly capture the essence of who Eliza was and all that she gave to this world. 

She was sassy and unfiltered (much like her parents). I.e. photo of her flicking off the camera with Dadda. 

We are hoping to incorporate this caricature drawing in a logo cover for a potential podcast we are working on. 

Or you can send us caricature sketches of all three of us. Whatever you feel like drawing. 

If you are interested, please sketch away and send us a photo of your artwork via our DMs. Or, if you want to send it to us directly, we can discuss the details of where to send it. 

P.S. We are willing to compensate one chosen artist for their hard work, time, and attentive creativity. And even though we will probably only choose one caricature sketch, please know we will look at ALL the caricature drawings and save them to our photo albums of Eliza. 
•
•
•
Lastly, thank you for showing Chance and myself such loving and genuine support as we navigate this new life. A life we never wanted but are forced to face. 

We love you all. 

And we hope that Eliza's life, short yet whole, continues to remind you of how significant, how beautiful every moment is.

Life has a beginning, a middle, and an end. And that the middle part, the "in between," is not to be overlooked or taken for granted.

Open your eyes. 

Make the most of whatever situation you're in. That's what Eliza did. 

And so must we. For her and for ourselves.

node.text:
"People who love each other are always connected by a very special String, made of love. Even though you can't see it with your eyes, you can feel it deep in your heart, and know that you are always connected to the ones you love" 

We love you, Eliza. Happy 3rd Birthday. We hope you're somewhere throwing rocks in ponds, chasing butterflies, swinging on tree branches, sledding down snow covered hills, building sand castles on beaches, and laughing so loud that the wind catches it and carries it to every earthbound soul that needs some extra love and encouragement today.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Kate Hudson on August 10, 2021. May be an image of 3 people, baby, people standing and outdoors.

node.text: Happy 3rd Birthday, Eliza 🦋 We love you. We celebrate you and your courageous, inspiring, impactful, unbelievably powerful life not only today, but also all the days in between.

node.text:
Thanks for the talk today. I know I've been distant. My grief has definitely not been linear. 

A lot of It comes down to the irrational thought that I am unworthy of your presence. That may seem like an absurd thing for your Mommy to think. But I do. 

Everyday, I think about all the things I would have done differently. I wish I had pushed you in your swing everyday like your Dadda did. I spent too many hours, too many days working or laying in bed feeling bad for myself. It makes me sick that I was so depressed that I may have pushed you away. So far away, you lived in a world where I didn't need to exist for you to be happy. I only ever wanted for you to feel a happiness beyond what even the best poets could manifest into words. 

I knew you didn't have much time left in this lifetime with us, so when you said "go away," I listened. I struggled knowing that I selfishly wanted time with you but that you didn't want time with me. I gave you space away from me. Too much space. 

Looking back, I know we had many of our own special moments. Still, I wish I would have gone on more walks with you. I wish I would have had the courage and strength to understand that you didn't really mean everything you said. That "go away" or "only Dadda" was just your way of testing the limits. Or maybe you did mean it. And that's OK. Still, as your Mommy, I wish I would have just been there, been with you more. Even if that means I only existed in the background while you played and laughed and danced and splashed in the bathtub.

I love you. More than you could ever fathom. 

Thanks for listening. And I'm sorry it took this long.
